name: How to Deploy a Node.js Application to AWS EC2
description: Complete step-by-step guide for deploying a Node.js application to Amazon EC2 with NGINX reverse proxy, SSL certificate, and PM2 process management.

step.name: Launch an EC2 Instance
step.text: Go to AWS Console, navigate to EC2 service, and launch a new instance with Ubuntu 22.04 LTS. Choose t2.micro for free tier eligibility. Configure security group to allow SSH (port 22), HTTP (port 80), and HTTPS (port 443).

step.name: Connect to Your Instance via SSH
step.text: Download your private key (.pem file) and connect to your instance using SSH. Update file permissions and connect with: ssh -i your-key.pem ubuntu@your-instance-ip

itemListElement.text: Open terminal and navigate to the directory containing your .pem file
Run: chmod 400 your-key.pem
Connect: ssh -i your-key.pem ubuntu@your-instance-ip

step.name: Update System and Install Dependencies
step.text: Update package lists and install Node.js, npm, and Git on your Ubuntu instance.

itemListElement.text: Update packages: sudo apt update && sudo apt upgrade -y
Install Node.js: curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_20.x | sudo -E bash - && sudo apt-get install -y nodejs
Verify installation: node --version && npm --version
Install Git: sudo apt install git -y

step.name: Clone and Configure Your Application
step.text: Clone your Node.js application from Git repository, install dependencies, and configure environment variables.

itemListElement.text: Clone repository: git clone https://github.com/yourusername/your-app.git
Navigate to directory: cd your-app
Install dependencies: npm install --production
Create .env file: nano .env
Add environment variables (PORT, DATABASE_URL, etc.)

step.name: Install and Configure PM2
step.text: Install PM2 process manager to keep your Node.js application running continuously and restart automatically on crashes or server reboots.

itemListElement.text: Install PM2 globally: sudo npm install -g pm2
Start your app: pm2 start app.js --name your-app-name
Configure auto-restart on system boot: pm2 startup systemd
Run the command PM2 provides, then: pm2 save
Check status: pm2 status

step.name: Install and Configure NGINX
step.text: Set up NGINX as a reverse proxy to forward requests from port 80 to your Node.js application running on port 3000 (or your configured port).

itemListElement.text: Install NGINX: sudo apt install nginx -y
Create server block: sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/your-app
Add configuration (see detailed config in article)
Create symbolic link: sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/your-app /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
Test configuration: sudo nginx -t
Restart NGINX: sudo systemctl restart nginx

step.name: Configure SSL with Let's Encrypt (Optional)
step.text: Add free SSL certificate using Certbot and Let's Encrypt to enable HTTPS for your application.

itemListElement.text: Install Certbot: sudo apt install certbot python3-certbot-nginx -y
Obtain certificate: sudo certbot --nginx -d yourdomain.com -d www.yourdomain.com
Follow prompts to configure automatic HTTPS redirect
Test auto-renewal: sudo certbot renew --dry-run

step.name: Configure Firewall
step.text: Set up UFW (Uncomplicated Firewall) to allow only necessary incoming traffic.

itemListElement.text: Allow SSH: sudo ufw allow OpenSSH
Allow HTTP: sudo ufw allow 'Nginx Full'
Enable firewall: sudo ufw enable
Check status: sudo ufw status

step.name: Verify Deployment
step.text: Test your deployed application and verify all components are working correctly.

itemListElement.text: Visit your domain or IP address in a browser
Check PM2 status: pm2 status
Check NGINX status: sudo systemctl status nginx
View application logs: pm2 logs your-app-name
Test SSL certificate (if configured): https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/
